tasks.task: Visiting a Pioneer hybrid corn demonstration.
subtasks: Meeting Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas.
Observing open-pollinated corn field versus Pioneer hybrid corn field.
Analyzing the differences in stalk rigidity and ear position.
Examining root systems of open-pollinated vs. hybrid corn.
Demonstrating mechanical corn picker efficiency on Pioneer hybrid corn.
Processing and transporting the harvested corn.

tasks.task: Bob Garst and Charlie Thomas are mentioned. So there's a subtask related to meeting them, maybe. But Wait, the main point is the demonstration of hybrid corn. So the primary task is likely "Visiting a Pioneer hybrid corn demonstration," hence the MAINTASK.
Visiting a Pioneer hybrid corn demonstration.
subtasks: Noting the physical differences between open-pollinated and hybrid corn in the fields.
Analyzing the root systems of corn plants.
Observing the mechanical corn picker operation.
Harvesting corn from the hybrid field and loading it onto trucks.

tasks.task: Visiting a Pioneer hybrid corn demonstration.
subtasks: Conduct a visual inspection of an open-pollinated corn field, noting characteristics such as shagginess, broken stalks, and ear drop.
Conduct a visual inspection of a Pioneer hybrid corn field, noting characteristics like rigid stalks, uniform ear height, and absence of fallen ears.
Analyze the root systems of open-pollinated and hybrid corn plants by comparing size and structure.
Demonstrate operation of a mechanical corn picker to harvest hybrid corn.
Harvest corn from the hybrid field using the mechanical picker and load it onto waiting trucks.
Transport harvested corn from the field to the processing plant.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Visiting a Pioneer hybrid corn demonstration.
subtasks: Conducting a visual inspection and noting the characteristics of open-pollinated corn in the field, including shagginess, broken stalks, and ear drop.
Conducting a visual inspection and noting the characteristics of Pioneer hybrid corn in the field, such as rigid stalks, uniform ear height, and absence of fallen ears.
Analyzing the root systems of open-pollinated and hybrid corn by comparing their size and structure.
Demonstrating the operation of a mechanical corn picker on hybrid corn.
Harvesting corn using the mechanical picker and loading it onto trucks.
Observing the transport of harvested corn to the processing plant.
